title: 75/7. Cooperation between the United Nations and the Central European Initiative

Seventy-fifth session

Cooperation between the United Nations and regional and 
other organizations: cooperation between the United Nations 
and the Central European Initiative 
 
 
 
 
 Resolution adopted by the General Assembly 
on 23 November 2020 
 
 
 
 
[without reference to a Main Committee (A/75/L.16 and A/75/L.16/Add.1)] 
 
 
 
75/7. Cooperation between the United Nations and the Central 
European Initiative 
 
 
 
The General Assembly, 
 
Recalling its resolution 66/111 of 9 December 2011, by which it granted 
observer status to the Central European Initiative,  
 
Recalling also its resolutions 67/7 of 19 November 2012, 69/8 of 11 November 
2014, 71/13 of 21 November 2016 and 73/10 of 26 November 2018, in which it 
invited the specialized agencies and other organizations and programmes of the 
United Nations system to cooperate with the Initiative in order to continue joint 
activities for the achievement of common objectives,  
 
Recalling further the Articles of the Charter of the United Nations that 
encourage activities through regional cooperation to promote the goals and objectives 
of the United Nations, 
 
Appreciating the active involvement of the Initiative in establishing cooperation 
with the United Nations system and relevant international and regional organizations, 
aimed at the furthering of political and socioeconomic development by covering all 
its relevant dimensions, 
 
Taking note of the report of the Secretary-General submitted pursuant to 
resolution 73/10,1 
 
1. 
Notes with appreciation the joint declaration adopted by the Ministers for 
Foreign Affairs of the Central European Initiative member States, on the occasion of 
the thirtieth anniversary of the Initiative, in Trieste on 12 June 2019 under the

presidency of Italy, reiterating the importance of the interaction between the United 
Nations and the Central European Initiative;  
 
2. 
Welcomes the important role consistently played by the Central European 
Initiative as a promoter of political dialogue and as a flexible and pragmatic platform 
for regional cooperation, thus supporting peace, stability, security and the economic 
progress of its member States, including through the upholding of democratic values, 
the rule of law and fundamental rights and freedoms, as well as good-neighbourly 
relations, and through the implementation of tangible projects and programmes in 
priority fields;  
 
3. 
Reaffirms that regional cooperation is an effective form of multilateralism 
contributing to the promotion of the purposes and principles of the United Nations;  
 
4. 
Recognizes, in this context, the Initiative’s response to global challenges, 
such as to the recent coronavirus disease (COVID-19) outbreak, which has caused 
enormous health, economic and social consequences to the entire world population, 
through the establishment of a joint Central European Initiative-World Health 
Organization task force as well as through self-standing initiatives and actions under 
the 2020 presidency of Montenegro for effectively tackling the challenges in the 
Central European Initiative region; 
 
5. 
Appreciates the joint statement on solidarity and cooperation of the Central 
European Initiative member States in the face of the challenges posed by COVID-19, 
adopted by the Heads of Government of the States members of the Initiative at their 
virtual meeting held on 15 May 2020 under the presidency of Montenegro; 
 
6. 
Values the ongoing commitment of the States members of the Central 
European Initiative to the implementation of the Central European Initiative Plan of 
Action 2018–2020, adopted at the Central European Initiative summit held in Minsk 
in December 2017 during the presidency of Belarus, aimed at promoting the 
connectivity and valorizing the diversity in the region; 
 
7. 
Acknowledges that the Central European Initiative Plan of Action 2018–2020 
was elaborated in line with the 2030 Agenda for Sustainable Development, 2 and thus 
bears in mind that interconnectivity in sustainable development can facilitate the 
effective translation of sustainable development policies into concrete action at the 
regional and national levels; 
 
8. 
Values, in this context, the efforts made so far in support of the 2030 
Agenda and the Sustainable Development Goals, as well as the continuous 
commitment of the Initiative to contribute to the attainment of the 2030 Agenda, 
especially in the context of this last decade of action, also with the Plan of Action 
2021–2023, under preparation;  
 
9. 
Notes with appreciation the organization, under the presidency of Italy, by 
the Central European Initiative during the high-level political forum on sustainable 
development in 2019 of a side event, “The contribution of regional cooperation and 
partnerships to the implementation of the 2030 Agenda: the experience of the Central 
European Initiative”, in New York on 17 July 2019, aimed at exchanging knowledge 
and experiences with all relevant stakeholders regarding best practices of regional 
partnership;  
 
10. Appreciates the outcome of the meeting of the ministers responsible for 
research, innovation and higher education in the Central European Initiative member 
States held on 13 December 2019 in Trieste under the presidency of Italy, stressing

the importance of enhanced cooperation between the Initiative and the United Nations 
on the implementation of the 2030 Agenda; 
 
11. 
Notes the continuous efforts of the Initiative to promote an effective 
multilateralism, recalling that transnational threats can be successfully addressed only 
through cooperation and joint actions, and recognizing the need for strong and 
innovative leadership to manage crises such as COVID-19 at the local, national and 
international levels, including by empowering women leaders; 
 
12. Recognizes the activities of the Initiative aimed at strengthening regional 
cooperation in such priority fields as good governance, including migration, 
digitalization and anti-corruption; economic growth, including in transport, research 
and innovation, the bioeconomy and blue growth, and sustainable development and 
entrepreneurship; environmental protection, including climate change, energy, in 
particular renewable energy and energy efficiency, and biodiversity; intercultural 
cooperation, including social integration; media freedom; and scientific cooperation 
and education, including lifelong learning; 
 
13. Welcomes the ongoing efforts to elaborate and implement concrete 
regional projects in these fields; 
 
14. Calls for greater cooperation between the Initiative and international 
financial institutions, with a view to exploring possibilities for co-financing regional 
projects;  
 
15. 
Welcomes, in this context, the Initiative’s relations with the European Bank 
for Reconstruction and Development through the Central European Initiative Fund at the 
European Bank for Reconstruction and Development, entirely financed by Italy, which 
provides mainly grant-type assistance for specific components of technical cooperation 
projects, linked to large operations of the Bank in States members of the Central 
European Initiative that are not members of the European Union; 
 
16. Also welcomes the financing of small-scale multilateral projects in the 
priority fields by the Central European Initiative Cooperation Fund, to which all 
member States contribute, and of projects related to capacity-building and the sharing 
of good practices between States members of the Central European Initiative that are 
members of the European Union and those that are not, through the Know-how 
Exchange Programme, financed by Italy; 
 
17. Appreciates the vigorous efforts of the Initiative to support, elaborate and 
realize joint regional projects in strategic areas in cooperation with other important 
regional and international players; 
 
18. Acknowledges, in this context, the fruitful cooperation between the Central 
European Initiative and the European Union, as one of the main co-funders of such 
projects, and supports the efforts of the Initiative to take concrete steps to establish 
other mutually beneficial partnerships with the European Union; 
 
19. Also acknowledges the efforts undertaken by the Initiative in intensifying 
cooperation with other international and regional organizations and initiatives, thus 
remaining committed to fostering broad multi-stakeholder partnerships in the region; 
 
20. Notes the ongoing contributions of the Central European Initiative bodies, 
in particular the Central European Initiative Parliamentary Assembly, to the 
strengthening of the multifaceted regional cooperation in the region; 
 
21. Also notes the continuous efforts within the Initiative, and its Executive 
Secretariat, aimed at increasing its efficiency and effectiveness;  
 
22. Values the commitment of the Initiative to promoting fruitful cooperation 
with the United Nations, the specialized agencies and other organizations and

programmes of the United Nations system, with the aim of achieving mutual 
participation in events and meetings of common interest and developing practical and 
results-oriented joint projects and actions; 
 
23. Welcomes, in this context, the cooperation established between the 
Initiative and the World Health Organization Regional Office for Europe, through the 
establishment of a joint task force in response to the COVID-19 emergency in the 
Central European Initiative region with the support of the 2020 presidency of 
Montenegro; 
 
24. Encourages the specialized agencies and other organizations and 
programmes of the United Nations system to establish cooperation with the Initiative 
through common action aimed at achieving the shared goals; 
 
25. Invites the Secretary-General to intensify the exchange with the Initiative 
in order to continue the fruitful cooperation and to facilitate coordination between the 
secretariats; 
 
26. Requests the Secretary-General to submit to the General Assembly at its 
seventy-seventh session a report on the implementation of the present resolution; 
 
27. Decides to include in the provisional agenda of its seventy-seventh 
session, under the item entitled “Cooperation between the United Nations and 
regional and other organizations”, the sub-item entitled “Cooperation between the 
United Nations and the Central European Initiative”.

23 November 2020
